metadata.title: Rat Coronavirus (RCV): A Prevalent, Naturally Occurring Pneumotropie Virus of Rats 1

abstract.original_text: A new virus isolated from the lungs of rats is prevalent in colony reared and wild rats and induces a fatal pneumonitis in newborn rats. The virus, designated as rat coronavirus (RCV), exhibits properties representative of the coronavirus group: characteristic surface structure, particles somewhat variable in size averaging approximately 90 m~z, apparent R2ffA content, essential lipid, heat sensitivity, and a close serologic relationship with the mouse hepatitis virus complex. I~CV grows well in primary rat kidney cell cultures, exhibits a pathognomonic type CPE, and produces a complement fixing antigen which is sensitive for detection of antibody and useful in sero-epidemiologie studies.

heat sensitivity , and a close serologic relationship with the mouse hepatitis virus complex .
I ~ CV grows well in primary rat kidney cell cultures ,
and produces a complement fixing antigen which is sensitive for detection of antibody and useful in sero-epidemiologie studies .
